item.title: Fly tipping/ overloaded bin, 28th June
item.description:

item.title: Cars regularly blocking pavement, 28th June
item.description:
Cars are regularly parked side by side at the end of Freda Street (junction with marine street) making it difficult for pedestrians, cyclists and wheelchair users to pass out of the end of this pedestrianised street. Clearer signage and stronger enforcement are needed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Freda Street, Bermondsey, London

item.title: Header Tanks continually over flow, 28th June

item.title: Tree felled without notice, 28th June
item.description:
On Friday morning (27 June) my 90 year old mother, who has lived at 8 Birchwood Avenue (BR3 3PZ) — an attractive birch tree-lined road — for nearly 50 years , was very distressed that the birch tree outside her house was cut down. She has not had any prior notice that this would be happening, and we understand from neighbours that they hadn’t either. Please see photos attached — she believed the tree to be completely healthy, so she is concerned this was an act of vandalism. She is very sad and said “Will I not see another tree there in my lifetime?”. I would be very grateful if you would investigate, and would also like to enquire if it would be possible to plant a replacement sapling?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gordon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
